                                EnumSet<ConfigurationUtils.State> wrt)
        Return the subset of online nodes that host at least one virtual machines
        Parameters:
        cfg - the configuration to browse
        wrt - the hosting type to consider
        Returns:
        subset of node that may be empty

                                  ConfigurationUtils.State wrt)

      • currentlyOverloadedNodes

        public static ManagedElementSet<Node> currentlyOverloadedNodes(Configuration cfg)
        Return the subset of nodes that are currently overloaded. A node is considered as overloaded if the total memory or CPU currently consumed by the virtual machines it hosts is greater than its memory or CPU capacity.
        Returns:
        a subset of nodes, may be empty.

      • currentlyOverloaded

        public static boolean currentlyOverloaded(Configuration cfg,
                          Node n)
        Indicates if a node is overloaded A node is currently overloaded if the total memory or CPU consumption of the virtual machines it hosts is greater than its memory or CPU capacity.
        Returns:
        true if the node is overloaded. false if not or if it is offline

      • futureOverloaded

        public static boolean futureOverloaded(Configuration cfg,
                       Node n)
        Indicates if a node will be saturated. A node will be saturated if the total memory or CPU demand of the virtual machines it hosts is greater than its memory or CPU capacity.
        Returns:
        true if the node is saturated. false if not or if it is offline

      • futureOverloadedNodes

        public static ManagedElementSet<Node> futureOverloadedNodes(Configuration cfg)
        Return the subset of nodes that can not satisfy the resource demand of the VMs. A node is considered as overloaded if the total memory or CPU demand of the virtual machines it hosts is greater than its memory or CPU capacity.
        Returns:
        a subset of nodes, may be empty.

      • isCurrentlyViable

        public static boolean isCurrentlyViable(Configuration cfg)
        Check whether the current configuration is overloaded or not.
        Returns:
        true if at least one node is overloaded

      • isFutureViable

        public static boolean isFutureViable(Configuration cfg)
        Check whether the current configuration will be overloaded once all the virtual machines will want to uses their demanded resources.
        Returns:
        true if at least one node is overloaded

      • subConfiguration

        public static Configuration subConfiguration(Configuration cfg,
                             ManagedElementSet<VirtualMachine> vms,
                             ManagedElementSet<Node> nodes)
                                      throws ConfigurationsException
        Compute a sub configuration that only consider a subset of nodes and virtual machines All the virtual machines must be hosted on the subset of nodes or be in a waiting state
        Parameters:
        vms - the subset of virtual machines
        nodes - the subset of nodes
        Returns:
        a new configuration is the operation succeed, null otherwise
        Throws:
        ConfigurationsException

      • merge

        public static Configuration merge(List<Configuration> cfgs)
                           throws ConfigurationsException
        Merge a list of Configurations. The set of virtual machines in the configuration is supposed to be disjoint while if some nodes are presents in different configurations, there state have to be the same
        Parameters:
        cfgs - the list of configurations to merge
        Returns:
        the resulting configuration
        Throws:
        ConfigurationsException - if configurations are conflicting between each other

      • merge

        public static Configuration merge(Configuration... cfgs)
                           throws ConfigurationsException
        Merge a list of Configurations. The set of virtual machines in the configuration is supposed to be disjoint while if some nodes are presents in different configurations, there state have to be the same
        Parameters:
        cfgs - the list of configurations to merge
        Returns:
        the resulting configuration
        Throws:
        ConfigurationsException - if configurations are conflicting between each other
